title: Stress resilience and risk of psychiatric disorders after childhood bereavement
text:
We have a new paper published in JAMA Network Open [URL] today which I am very excited to share. This work stems from when I was a Visiting Researcher at Karolinska Institutet in 2024.
Here, we leverage the unique Swedish population register data to study the long-term effects of childhood bereavement on risk of psychiatric disorder. Furthermore, we aim to shed light on the role of stress resilience in this relationship.

title: Research
text: The primary focus of my research is how environmental factors across multiple levels, from individual life experiences to within-family interactions to societal factors, impact the development of mental health problems in young people and adults. See also my Google Scholar profile.

title: This blog
text: On this blog I will share interesting new research in the mental health field as well as some of my own work.

title: Ludvig Daae Bj√∏rndal (Cand.Psychol., PhD)
text:
My name is Ludvig Daae Bj√∏rndal. I am a trained clinical psychologist (Cand. Psychol.) and researcher (PhD).
I am really interested in why some people develop mental health problems and what can be done to alleviate these. The primary focus of my research is how environmental factors shape risk of mental disorders in young people and adults. In addition, I have a keen interest in how to understand mental health beyond diagnostic systems and sum scores of individual symptoms.
Here, I share all of my research and academic CV. I also have a blog where I spotlight what I perceive as important new research in the mental health field and also some of my own work. You can also read more about me on my academic website (University of Oslo).
I am affiliated with the PROMENTA Research Center (University of Oslo) and the PsychGen Centre for Genetic Epidemiology and Mental Health (Lovisenberg Diaconal Hospital and Norwegian Institute of Public Health).
